sentence.Network_en: Still they believed the accusations of the priests and looked upon Christ as a malefactor.
sentence.Network_cn: 但他们还相信祭司们的控告,看基督是个罪犯.

英语词源研究_coldform_新浪博客 ... magnify（ 放大）， malefactor（ 犯罪分子）， mechanical（ 机械的），.

list.abs: David cameron , returning early on august 9th , warned that even young malefactors would feel the full force of the law .8月9日早就返回的davidcameron（首相）警告说即使是年轻罪犯也要让他们感受一下法律的威严。

because the inserted command may have additional strings appended to it before it is executed , the malefactor terminates the injected string with a comment mark " -- " .因为插入的命令可能在执行之前已追加了其他字符串，攻击者可以使用注释标记“--”终止注入的字符串。
1907 年罗斯福把反对政府决策的资产阶级称为 malefactors of great wealth 罪恶的大富豪。从那以来,这句话就用来抨击经济大行业的反社会性。 Mr.Bush has shown.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin, from malefact- 'done wrong', from the verb malefacere, from male 'ill' + facere 'do'

entry.def: A malefactor is someone who has done something bad or illegal.

example.ex: ...a well-known criminal lawyer who had saved many a malefactor from going to jail.
example.tran: 一位使许多犯罪分子避免锒铛入狱的著名刑事律师

means.word_mean: 1. someone who has committed (or been legally convicted of) a crime

auth_sentence.content: He may reprieve a condemned malefactor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He may reprieve a condemned malefactor.

auth_sentence.content: If a malefactor is beyond the grasp of justice, he simply kills him.
